description:
This is a great piece of software that seemlessly alows mouse and keyboard to be shared between computers. 
Setup was a bit tricky as I was not sure how it was all meant to work. I managed to find setup instructions online.
I have replaced a KVM switch that was used for multiple computers to share my keyboard and mouse. 
My setup now operates as if all monitors are connected to the same machine. Amazing. I wish I knew about this software sooner...

I already installed it in 20 computers and everytime is complicated. Autostart and saving configuration is still kind of randomly working. I mean, when it finally work I am still not sure why... Painfull tbut usefull.ing
Umlauts are not working with 2.3.4, apparently got fixed in 2.4.

Once you get it working, You might love it.

I am a part-time Linux user, full-time Mac user. It was not easy for me to get Barrier to work with my Mac and Dell, but it was great after getting everything to work.

I am using Barrier with my MacBook Pro (Mid 2014) with macOS Mojave as a server and Dell Inspiron 13-7353 (2015-ish) with Xubuntu (Ubuntu 19.04) as a client. Sometimes cursor will be jumping around or client machine might get disconnected waking up from sleep. But overall, I would recommend Barrier over any paid solutions to date. I am comparing Barrier with my experiences with Logitech Flow and Synergy Symless.
summary: It is definitely worth a try

description: I tried to use this via Wired ethernet to Wifi, and I would see errors that the client (Wifi) couldn't connect to the server (Wired). As soon as I put the client on the wired ethernet network, it was able to connect to the server and you get the confirmation about the server key on the client side and you accept it, and it works going from Linux to Windows, and Linux to Linux. It's very useful, I have a monitor that has two inputs, with two systems connected to it. I switch the monitor and use Barrier to be able to use the Keyboard and Mouse (Logitech USB Wireless Combo) to navigate both systems.
summary: Works well, must be on same physical network

description: I'm a paid Synergy user but I have flipped to Barrier as it appears to just be that much better. Cut, paste, keyboard and mouse sharing, and set and forget type functionality make this a winner.
Been Using this Apps At Home And Office
summary: Best Cross Platform Mouse And Keyboard Sharing

description: Some issues on auto loading configuration. Seems after adding to startup, it doesn't configure itself by auto loading config or previous config for that matter, so it must be configured manually on each restart. But then, I don't restart all that often, unless I absolutely have to, so... I'm happy. 10 Stars
summary: This app is awesome! It deserves 5 stars!

description: i launched it and was trying to connect to my mac with ubunto 20 as the server. My entire ubuntu UI locked up and I had to power off. Complete failure.
I know they have a small team and they are working to improve, but keep one eye on your system monitor.
Works great from Windows 10 to Fedora 31 but on X11 session.

The version available as of July 6 2020 has a memory leak, which if you dont watch out for can crash your system if oom-killer doesnt get it in time. Also segfaults repeatedly, but self-restarts.

I've loved synergy for years, thank you for carrying it forward with Barrier... just a few bugs to fix!
When I have this program running, between a Mac server and Linux client, I have a substantial increase in outgoing bandwidth, in the GB every hour. I've uninstalled this as I do not trust it

I got it setup between my work and personal computer and I can seamlessly switch using same mouse & keyboard. A little confused on setup at first:
1) Start server
2) Start client, enter IP of server
3) On server, Configure screen (client should now appear)
This is so easy to set up and use. It has saved me a lot of trouble of setup and hours of time.
summary: Best mouse and keyboard sharing software ever

description: It doesn't work when Windows is server and linux is client.
Works as a charm
Simple program, superb idea! I use it on all my computers to not have to have a mountain of keyboards on my desk.
great program easy to use
easy to use and very useful
Works perfectly
what an app, just made my two laptops work together in easy steps

Finallly made decision to revert my Ubuntu to 20.04 2.0 LTS in order to use the beautiful software.

Thanks folks.
something is not working with ubuntu 21.04, the mouse is shared but you can't see it

Haven't been able to get this on any computer (Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS nor Win 10) within my home network to work with this program at all (all connected off the same LAN switch). Checked firewalls (both client side and network side) and can Ping each machine OK. 

Scoured the net for solutions and troubleshooting guides. None of them lead to a resolution. Now faced with "Failed to connect to secure socket" on the client side. Disabled Cryto just to check, and ended up with a hang at "fontconfig error" for all machines.

It's a nice concept, but the written documentation could do with some improvement and enhancement. Decided it was beyond my abilities to setup, cut my losses after 2 hours and abandoned it. If there are prereqs that need setting up before hand, I feel the documentation should be updated to include this. Cheers.
summary: Haven't been able to get this to work on 20.04.3 LTS nor Windows 10

description:
Worked for a while, then failed. Complete reinstall can't fix. Configuration screens are cryptic. No help. 
Total waste of time.
Server and client paired, but I cannot move mouse to another screen
great virtual kvm app on any OS, highly recommended
summary: great virtual kvm app, highly recommended

description: Read the manual first, might not work if you don't do that
summary: Good app, I use it to share keyboard with my MacBook

description: Totally waste of time not working
Tried some other apps earlier but non of them worked like this one. Initially had some trouble but got the solutions online then onwards it is flawless.
great app, but I have to use the .deb instead of flatpak because the flatpak decides to quit after a few minutes to an hour of running.
summary: flatpak app does not stay running

description: does not function in any way

Seemlessly use of single mouse and keyboard across 3 computers, one of which is dual-monitor. It feels like one computer with quad monitors, just move the mouse and click on an active window that accepts input from the single keyboard. Copy and paste text from a single clipboard.
summary: Beats any KVM if you don't need to share a monitor

description:
On current Ubuntu releases, this app sadly does not work: It can't control your mouse pointer. Only in older apps, it technically works, but you still don't see a mouse pointer.

If you use an Ubuntu version newer than 21.04, this app won't work for you.
summary: Does not work on current Linux desktops

description: Un peu problématique à configurer, mais une fois que c'est fait plus aucun problème

Dont work properly ! but If I put Barrier Window along the left side (my right side) of the display and the mouse go on this Window, I can go throught to the other Screen (Windows 10).. and the keyboard and copy past work on the 2 computers.. But it stop as soon as there are 2 Browsers launched, whatever firefox ~ Chrome, one on each computer...

j'utilise cette application de control sur windows et linux. il permet de prendre le control de 2 pc avec une seul souris/clavier, c'est pratique pour faire du dépannage, réparation, remise a zero des pc sans ce prendre la tete avec tous en double, c'est bien plus rapide.

c'est sur, la 1er fois il faut pouvoir le configurer, mais une fois fait, on range le 2em clavier/souris et on peu travaillé sur les 2 pc avec 1 seul péripherique.

il fonctionne meme entre windows et linux, je suis d'ailleurs entraint d'utilisé mon clavier branché sur windows et je vous ecrit sur Linux que je vient de formaté, pratique NON !
Ubuntu 22.04 connect windows10 can't show mouse icon.

not support ubuntu22.04 connect win10 yet, but can fix by change windows system back to X11 (wayland has too many bugs)

try this:
sudo gedit /etc/gdm3/custom.conf
unnote "#WaylandEnable=false"
save file and restart system.
我操作的是windows10和ubuntu20.04键鼠联动，搞半天发现是另一个barrier软件吐了。
